ja60:1.1: The story is similar to the previous, except here the instrument is a conch or horn, and the father is the overplayer, not the son.
ja60:1.2: Mil 3.1.4:6.8 discusses what happens when a horn player breathes out too much.
ja60:1.4: Dhamaṁ is nominative singular. We can capture the pun between dhama (“blowing”) and vidhamī (“squandered it”, “blew it”).
